title: Country diary: Nothing more than a cormorant – and that’s fine by me | Sara Hudston
summary: In West Bay, Dorset, the presence of 'Reggie' the dolphin prompts reflections on what constitutes a healthy interaction with nature. The author considers the impact of these encounters, including a moment with a hungry seabird. This contemplation highlights the importance of wildlife interactions in fostering a connection with the natural world.

title: Spain and Portugal wildfire weather made 40 times more likely by climate crisis, study finds
summary: Scientists report that recent wildfires have been 30% more intense due to the effects of global warming. This link underscores the impact of climate change on wildfire severity. The findings highlight the urgent need for addressing global heating to mitigate future fire risks.

title: Britain’s illegal e-bike boom: desperation, delivery drivers – and unthinkable danger
summary: E-bikes are legally allowed to reach speeds of 15.5 mph, but some modified versions have been recorded traveling up to 70 mph. This raises concerns about safety and regulation as the popularity of high-speed e-bikes increases. Authorities are questioning how to effectively manage and prevent the rise of these potentially dangerous vehicles.

title: Energy users ‘could save £5bn a year’ if gas plants are removed from market
summary: A former energy tsar has proposed a "radical step" for the government to consider in order to reduce energy bills. This suggestion comes amid rising costs and seeks to address financial pressures on consumers. The recommendation highlights the limited options available for effective relief.
